page.title: 13Changing Times
page.content: The shops are very different to those of fifty years ago. The{village store and{bakery,}run by Mrs Playle and her five sons, was where Herrings Way and Ponders Road now meet. Bread was made daily and delivered on Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays. On Saturday nights people often paid{one penny}to put meat or a cake in the baker's oven to cook. There is no bakery now and the present shop is where a very small shop used to be fifty years ago. Almost everything was sold in the shop, including{boots,}and food like butter and sugar had to be bagged and weighed. The{post}was delivered by two people, one lady on foot, covering the West of the village, and one man on his bicycle, to do the rest. Now we have a man on a scooter.{Milk}kept in churns was delivered daily by horse and cart.
